meanings.definition: Pterosaurs: extinct flying reptiles of the Mesozoic era.
meanings.sent1: The museum had a fascinating exhibit on pterosaurs.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study pterosaurs to learn more about ancient flying creatures.
meanings.sent3: The pterosaurs in the museum came to life at night and had a party.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination took flight like a pterosaur soaring through the sky.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the size of the pterosaurs' wingspans.

meanings.definition: Pterosaurs: a group of prehistoric creatures with wingspans ranging from a few inches to over 30 feet.
meanings.sent1: The tiny pterosaurs were as small as birds.
meanings.sent2: The fossil record shows the diversity of pterosaurs' wingspans.
meanings.sent3: The pterosaurs with tiny wings tried to compete in the flying race.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were as wide and varied as the wingspans of pterosaurs.
meanings.sent5: The children marveled at the different sizes of the pterosaurs' wingspans.

meanings.definition: Pterosaurs: creatures that lived alongside dinosaurs and were the first vertebrates to evolve powered flight.
meanings.sent1: Pterosaurs were the pioneers of aerial travel in the prehistoric world.
meanings.sent2: The discovery of pterosaurs' fossils shed light on their evolutionary history.
meanings.sent3: The pterosaurs and dinosaurs had a friendly competition in flying skills.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as strong as a pterosaur's wings.
meanings.sent5: The ancient skies were ruled by the majestic flight of pterosaurs.
